Description: An inbound completion TLP was received with status of completer abort (CA).
An inbound completion TLP was received with status of unsupported request (UR).
An MSI interrupt was received on the BLIF inbound interface with a size greater than one data beat (16-byte).
An MSI interrupt was received and was not 16-byte address aligned.
Reserved.

Field Mnemonic: BLIF Inbound Header ECC Correctable (CE) Error
Description: An ECC CE detected on an inbound BLIF command header.

Field Mnemonic: BLIF Inbound Header ECC Uncorrectable (UE) Error
Description: An ECC UE detected on an inbound BLIF command header.
More than one stage valid indication was asserted in the same clock cycle.
A release of an unused TCE Tag is attempted.
An attempt to use a TCE Tag that is already in use.
A buffer overflow condition.
A buffer underflow condition.
An internal logic parity error was detected.
A buffer overflow condition.
A buffer underflow condition.
An internal logic parity error was detected.

Field Mnemonic: BLIF Header Control Bits Parity Error
Description: A parity error was detected on the BLIF header control bits.

Field Mnemonic: BLIF Data Control Bits Parity Error
Description: A parity error was detected on the BLIF data control bits.

A command was received on the BLIF interface indicating it was an unsupported request. A 'Nonposted' request will be acknowledged with a Comple- tion response with UR status. A 'Posted' request type will be dropped.
A completion was received on the BLIF interface with a time- out indication. The PCIE/PBL block detected the timeout and reported it via the BLIF interface.

Field Mnemonic: SEID Table ECC Correctable (CE) Error (vA4.1) Secure Address Error (vA4.2)
Description: An ECC CE detected in the SEID table. (vA4.1). Secure Address Error (vA4.2). Non-translated DMA address matched against secure address checker. Refer to Section 4.7.2.1 UV - Secure Address Exclude CMP/MSK Register on page 295.

Field Mnemonic: SEID Table ECC Uncorrectable (UE) Error (vA4.1) Reserved (vA4.2)
Description: An ECC UE detected in the SEID table. (vA4.1). Reserved (vA4.2).

A Non-Blocking Write was received on the BLIF inbound interface with invalid size. The legal NBW sizes are 16, 32, 64, and 128B. In addition, the size and address alignment of the transaction must match.
An internal fatal error detected related to the IODA tables inside the DEC block. This covers the MIST, SEID, and TVT tables.
A DMA Write was received and its TLP header indicates that the data was poisoned. This includes writes that decode as MSI.
A correctable ECC error was detected in this table's array.
IODA Error: An access to an invalid TVT entry.
The PE# (as fetched from the RTT) for an MSI did not match the PE# assigned to this Source ID that was stored in the MIST.

IODA Error: The PCI Address was out of range as defined by the TTA bounds in the TVE entry. Note: As of POWER9 PHB4, the logic will not flag an error for 32-bit DMAs that are configured as non-translated.
A correctable ECC error was detected in this table's array.
An uncorrectable ECC error was detected in this table's array.
An uncorrectable ECC error was detected in this table's array.
An Error Message attempted to access the PELT-V BAR when it was disabled.
A parity error occurred in one of the IODA tables in the DEC block.
A timeout occurred in the PCT table. A PCI completion was never returned for a PCIe request.
A PCI completion was received but did not match any out- standing requests.
A parity error occurred in the PCI Completion Table.
More than one stage valid indication was asserted in the same clock cycle.
A parity error detected in the control pipeline stages.

The condition set up by the PAPR Error Injection Registers triggered its intended condition to inject an inbound error. This is more of a status than an error, but it can be treated like a normal error.

Field Mnemonic: DMA/MSI: RTE PE Number All Ones Error
Description: The PE number in the RTE was all ones (all 16 bits). This indicates that it is an invalid entry.
A request attempted to access the RTT BAR when it was disabled.
An internal parity error was detected in the RTC logic.
An overflow condition occurred in one of the RTC queues.
An underflow condition occurred in one of the RTC queues.
More than one stage valid indication was asserted in the same clock cycle.
An illegal state was reached in the RCAM.
A RTC Requester ID look up in the RCAM hit against multi- ple entries.
An internal parity error was detected in the RRB logic.

Field Mnemonic: RRB request Size / Align- ment Error
Description: A request to the Remote Register Block (RRB) for this macro had bad size or address alignment.
RXE_ARB local error, internal register bad address error.
RXE_ARB local error, internal register read / write access to a register had incorrect size or address alignment.
Reserved.

An error with an inbound DMA write that had discontiguous byte enables in the last byte enable (LBE). The error tests for the following: 1) LBE is fragmented, and the total byte count is > 8. 2) Address is not 8-byte aligned. This error should be an internal hardware problem because this condition should be caught as a malformed TLP error in the PCIE/PBL block.
Parity error detected in the LIST table.
PEST Data Queue signaled error.
The PHB4 received an ERR_FATAL message from an endpoint or switch.

Field Mnemonic: PCIE Nonfatal Error Mes- sage Received
Description: The PHB4 received an ERR_NONFATAL message from an endpoint or switch.
The PHB4 received an ERR_CORR message from an endpoint or switch.
Reserved.
